alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Chester; Crockett; Gibson; Haywood; Henderson; Madison; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 11:49PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Crockett, Henderson, southeastern Gibson, central Fayette, Hardeman, northern McNairy, southern Carroll, southeastern Haywood, Madison and Chester Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1148 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fairview to 6 miles east of Mercer to near Eads. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Humboldt, Milan, Lexington, Henderson, Bolivar, Natchez Trace State Park, Chickasaw State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Chickasaw State Forest, Fairview, Whiteville, Somerville, Bells, Three Way, Sardis, Silerton, Masseyville, Reagan and Hillville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for west Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Chester; Crockett; Gibson; Haywood; Henderson; Madison; McNairy
